snippet: The decision marked the first time since the economic crisis in 2008 that the German flag carrier announced a significant staff reduction.
abstract: Lufthansa will eliminate 3,500 administrative jobs as part of a wide-ranging effort to improve its profitability by 1.5 billion euros over the next three years; reports first-quarter loss of 397 million euros ($498 million), compared with a loss of 507 million euros in year-ago quarter.
lead_paragraph: The decision marked the first time since the economic crisis in 2008 that the German flag carrier announced a significant staff reduction.

headline.main: Lufthansa to Cut 3,500 Jobs in Bid to Improve Profitability
headline.print_headline: Lufthansa to Cut 3,500 Jobs to Lift Profit
